subject: Languages
title: Quebec French: A Time Capsule
description: One-minute skill: Quebec French: A Time Capsule.

hook.text: In 1763, France gave up Canada. The French speakers left behind preserved a 17th-century dialect.

buildup.text: Cut off from France, Quebec French kept vocabulary and pronunciations that Paris abandoned.

discovery.text: Quebecois say 'char' for car (from French 'char') while France adopted the English 'voiture.'

twist.text: Quebec passed laws making French mandatory on signs and in businesses to fight English creep.

climax.text: Today Quebec French is a proud identity â€” neither Parisian nor English, entirely its own.

punchline.text: Quebec kept the old French alive while France was busy reinventing it.

quiz.question: Why does Quebec French differ from Parisian French?
options: It was cut off from France and preserved older forms
